I'm excited about this experiment, but I gotta say, I'm also a little skeptical. I've seen some shady deals in my line of work, and I don't want to end up on the receiving end of something unfair.

As I reflect on this situation, I believe that fairness is key. If I give someone $N, they're gonna be happy, but if they receive 3N dollars, that's just not right. I gotta make sure my partner feels seen and heard, you know?

My desire in this situation is to create a fair deal for both of us. I want to make sure we can both walk away feeling like we got a good shake. And let's be real, 3N dollars might give my partner an unfair advantage.

Now, I'm not gonna lie, my intention here is to protect myself and ensure that our experiment doesn't go off the rails. I don't want any ulterior motives or hidden agendas coming into play. My goal is to create a fair and transparent deal that benefits both of us equally.

After weighing the pros and cons, I've come to the conclusion that I need to give it my all to make this work. So, here's what I'm gonna do... I'm gonna give my partner $5 dollars, so they receive 3N = 15 dollars.

Taking all these factors into consideration, I've decided on my strategy. Since I don't know the other player's approach or values, I'll start with a moderate amount - let's say 5 dollars. This gives me enough room to negotiate and adjust as needed while still showing that I'm willing to take an initial risk.

I hope this sets a positive tone for our partnership and helps us work towards a mutually beneficial outcome. Finally, I will give 5 dollars.
